item.title: Sands of Time's shock cancellation "does not mean we are stepping away from the franchise", says remake team
item.content:encoded:
Prince of Persia "as a universe and a legacy" continues to "matter deeply".

Ubisoft's Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake studio has shared a statement following its game's shock cancellation.

Last night, Ubisoft announced a "major organisational, operational and portfolio reset", which saw the company delay seven unspecified projects, close two studios and cancel multiple games. One such game was its Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake, which was unveiled in 2020, and had suffered numerous delays and setbacks since. Then, this week, came the final nail in the coffin.

The team behind Prince of Persia's embattled remake has now shared a few words of its own. Here, the studio acknowledged the cancellation was "deeply disappointing" for fans as well as the development team, however this "does not mean [its] stepping away from the franchise" for good.

In a social media post, Ubisoft's Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake studio wrote: "The game holds enormous meaning for fans and for the teams who worked on it.

"While the project had real potential, we weren't able to reach the level of quality you deserve, and continuing would have required more time and investment than we could reasonably commit. And, we didn't want to release something that fell short of what The Sands of Time represents."

It stated Prince of Persia "as a universe and a legacy" is still important to the studio, and Sands of Time's cancellation does not mean this is the end for the franchise as a whole. Closing, Ubisoft's studio thanked the community for its "passion, patience and love for Prince of Persia".

Many were surprised to learn Ubisoft was pulling the plug on its Sands of Time remake. Recent reports from the company had the game slated for release during"Q4" of its current financial year, which comes to an end on 31st March. So, in just a couple of months.

In June of last year, the Sands of Time remake was said to be "deep in development", after the project moved from its original developers Ubisoft Pune and Mumbai to Ubisoft Montreal, where it was seemingly rebooted from scratch.
